{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3563801,"name":"zoe","username":"amzoeee","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amzoeee/{size}/256065_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-21T03:11:15.978Z","cooked":"

Hi,

We are using an Arducam OV9281 and an OrangePi 5 (powered by a Zinc-V) to run PhotonVision. The camera mostly works, but twice, upon turning on the robot, we find that the camera status is “Active,” yet the camera feed displays “Camera Lost.” We tried unplugging and replugging the camera, restarting the robot code, but only a power cycle of the robot fixed it in both situations. We did not think to restart PhotonVision, but will do that next time this issue happens. It is not consistently reproducible.

From the second time this occurred:

pxl_20250321_0210099801920×2550 317 KB

(the second camera is meant to be disconnected)

Thanks!

Make sure the connector on the camera PCB is secure, it tends to get loose and do that. I hot glued that connector on ours.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-21T14:02:48.297Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":131,"readers_count":130,"score":46.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496411,"topic_slug":"arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62207,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The one crazy dude on 167"},"post_url":"/t/arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost/496411/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3563981,"name":"Jason Johnson","username":"jsjohn2000","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/a88e57/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-21T12:26:25.869Z","cooked":"

We are running photonvision on a Raspberry Pi 5 powered by a 12V DC-DC converter. At competition we noticed the cameras drop out at the start of competition. We consulted the logs and the battery voltage dropped at the start due to autonomous.

I was thinking if a separate power source would have mitigated the dropouts but not sure after reading your post.

We display camera feeds on our driver station using a webpage with image tags. A member of the drive tram just does a refresh on the webpage to get cameras back up.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-21T12:26:25.869Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":119,"readers_count":118,"score":43.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":496411,"topic_slug":"arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost","display_username":"Jason Johnson","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51771,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost/496411/3","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3563988,"name":"Jason Johnson","username":"jsjohn2000","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/a88e57/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-21T12:29:20.953Z","cooked":"

We initially had code in our robot to publish the camera to smart dashboard. The performance was very poor. We switched to have a webpage on the driver station directly connect to the host name and port of the camera. We only connected to two cameras (reef cam and climber cam).

We’ve seen the same thing, you need to cram those little white connectors on harder than you want to based upon their size AND hot glue them. Agree…big watch out.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-21T12:35:53.733Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":37.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496411,"topic_slug":"arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost","display_username":"Sam Geckler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":62207,"username":"TheComputer314","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thecomputer314/{size}/241453_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":21515,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost/496411/5","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566298,"name":"zoe","username":"amzoeee","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amzoeee/{size}/256065_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-23T22:30:49.828Z","cooked":"

Update: we reproduced the issue (not on purpose), and, upon restarting PhotonVision through the web dashboard, “fixed” the issue. This makes me think it might not be a connector issue. We have not hot glued it yet.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-23T22:31:36.175Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":86,"readers_count":85,"score":32.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":496411,"topic_slug":"arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost","display_username":"zoe","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60985,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost/496411/6","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566614,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-24T04:24:42.106Z","cooked":"

I’ve seen this. The first time was when a student accidentally nicked a com line. However, we’ve also seen this rarely on other occasions.

I can’t confirm this (insufficient cables for destructive testing), but I suspect the wiring is not twisted pair, like you’d normally get for USB wiring. This would make it more sensitive to noise, especially when tightly coiled up near big motors and other noisy power wiring.

You might try adjusting cable runs, or just testing with a new cable that’s far away from noise sources, and see if that seems to fix things.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-24T04:26:11.773Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":58,"readers_count":57,"score":71.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496411,"topic_slug":"arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2811 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost/496411/7","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566625,"name":"zoe","username":"amzoeee","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/amzoeee/{size}/256065_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-24T04:40:38.856Z","cooked":"

Will try fiddling around with the wires tomorrow, thanks! Any idea why it would happen upon robot power-on and be fixed upon restarting PhotonVision? That’s the part that makes me doubt that it’s a hardware/wiring issue.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-24T04:40:59.041Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":7,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":50,"readers_count":49,"score":25.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":496411,"topic_slug":"arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost","display_username":"zoe","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":44763,"username":"tekdemo","name":"Dan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60985,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost/496411/8","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566631,"name":"Dan","username":"tekdemo","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tekdemo/{size}/138330_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-24T04:52:24.603Z","cooked":"

Can’t say for sure, since I’m not sure how your wires are ran. Just adding one more item into your list of suspects.

I can also say we had a half-inch long metal shaving in our orange pi, and that caused some issues with cameras for a couple matches. Vacuuming that out helped. I think the only times we had “no camera” issues was before this, and never after.

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2025-03-24T04:52:24.603Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":48,"readers_count":47,"score":34.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":496411,"topic_slug":"arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost","display_username":"Dan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":44763,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2811 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/arducam-sporadically-displaying-camera-lost/496411/9","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3566691,"name":"guineawheek","username":"guineawheek","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/guineawheek/{size}/180797_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-24T08:14:51.030Z","cooked":"

We have this randomly happen to us like 1/20 power ons, and the solution we’ve come to is power cycling the robot and making sure both cameras are working before a match start.

I do wonder if soft-rebooting the Pis over SSH would fix it though, and we’re considering adding this as a recovery mechanism
